comment: don't like it. not a bad taste but it smells and taste almost exactly like Johnny walker black. reminded me of my younger days of irresponsibility drinking.
Smoky finish, nuts and fruits low sharp mellow

Nose: macallan-esq sherry apricot nose with caramel and pepper
Body: medium
Palate: malt, vanilla
Finish: medium
Note: this one is ok, not enough body. I guess I don’t see what the fuss is about with these Japanese malts. They seem to fall flat for me. And again more rice.
smoky and spicy at first taste, but easy to drink.

Nose: cherry and oak, but rather smooth/flat. 
Flavour: first strong alcohol hit, then some sweeter notes
Finish: almost wood polish like aftertaste. 

...not really for me.
Oily prune with a bite. I like. Love is much too strong for this.
Lightly sweet on the nose. Spicy with a medium bite, hints of vanilla. Short finish, a bit less refined than I would expect from a 12 year.
Fruity nose. Taste fruit and wood notes.  I would mistake this one for a scotch.
Soft on the nose with musty notes of dried leaves, bergamot and dried fruit
3.75 alot like Macallan but sweeter.  Clean initial taste of sherry and then a very sweet long aftertaste. A little hot

I had a Kurayoshi tasting night, and i had the Sherry Cask, the 12yo and the 18yo. Got to say this one was the loser on that night, because even if it is not a bad whisky, it is not something you will remember. 

Actually Kurayoshi is a blended malt (pure malt in japan) from scottish and japanese whiskies, from the Matsui distillery. 

Bottled at 43%abv

On the nose, it is an speyside whisky doppelganger with a little earthy note (which i found in every Kurayoshi).full Citric notes. Toffee. Grapefruit, Strong alcohol note; passion fruit. Earthy and Citric. Raw rice and Floral notes like a cheap Air freshener from a Taxi (a cab).

On the palate, too straightforward, but nice i guess. Dulce de leche (toffee), citric and pepper.

Aftertaste is intersting. Earthy like mud. Ginger. Very dry. 

Overall this is a whisky that is not bad, but lacks emotion. I guess that it's intention is to compete with other 12 year old whiskies out there (which might be the whiskies top competition) and for that purpose, it is a good offer. 77 over 100.
Impartial to sipping whiskeys.  This one is definitely my favorite experience.  It's got a fragrant nose and a fruit forward and embracing first sip.
